conclusion: To determine when particles A and B meet, we need to analyze their motion based on the given velocity-time graph.
Particle A starts from rest and accelerates linearly to a maximum velocity \(v_0\) in a time \(t_0\).
Particle B starts from rest and accelerates linearly to a maximum velocity \(v_0\) in a time \(t_0\).

premise: Both particles start from rest and reach the same maximum velocity \(v_0\) at the same time \(t_0\).
conclusion: Particles A and B meet at the time \(t_0\).

premise: The area enclosed by the v-t graph and the coordinate axes represents displacement. When the areas enclosed by the graphs of A and B with the coordinate axes are equal, A and B meet.
conclusion: From the graph, it can be seen that at \(t = 6t_0\), the displacements of A and B are equal, and they meet.
